BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO DEVELOP AND CULTIVATE EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AMONG STUDENTS OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE STUDENT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATION WAS CREATED FOR THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING AND CULTIVATING EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AMONG STUDENTS OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR STUDENT CLUBS AND ORGANIZATIONS, STUDENT GOVERNMENT, ORIENTATION, AND STUDENT LIFE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR STUDENT ATHLETIC AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL COMMENCEMENT AND FOR YEARBOOK.

BooksInCareOfDetail.PersonNm: HELEN CEDENO DEPT OF FINANCE BU

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BROOKLYN EVENTS CENTER LLC DBA BARCLAYS
MBJ CAFETERIA CORPORATION DBA MBJ FOOD S

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ASSOCIATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE ASSOCIATION PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE ASSOCIATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CHILDREN'S CENTER OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION MAKES CERTAIN ROUTINE GRANTS TO JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE'S LIBRARY AND CHILDREN'S CENTER. THESE MONIES ARE USED TO SUPPORT THE ACTIVITIES OF THESE ENTITIES IN LINE WITH THE ASSOCIATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE AND THE COLLEGE'S TAX-EXEMPT MISSION. THE ASSOCIATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO MONITOR THE USE OF THESE FUNDS AS IT IS GUARANTEED THAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEW OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS COORDINATED WITH THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE'S ACCOUNTING OFFICE AND THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM. WHEN THE REVIEW IS COMPLETED, THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED ELECTRONICALLY TO ALL OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE IT IS SIGNED AND/OR E-FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATEMENT IS NORMALLY DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS AT THE FIRST MEETING OF THE FISCAL YEAR. IF THERE IS A TRANSACTION THAT INDIRECTLY OR DIRECTLY DERIVES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT TO A PARTICULAR BOARD MEMBER, THEN HE OR SHE REMOVES HIM/HERSELF FROM THE BOARD'S ASSESSMENT OF THAT PARTICULAR TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION IS GOVERNED BY THE POLICIES OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

HONORARIA: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 304,315. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 14,950. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 319,265. OTHER SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 620,051. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 34,745. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 654,796.
NO CHANGES HAVE TAKEN PLACE DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023.
